meanings.definition: A slang term for a person's neck.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful necklace around her meck.
meanings.sent2: He turned his head to the side to stretch his meck muscles.
meanings.sent3: The meck of the giraffe was long and graceful.
meanings.sent4: Her meck was like a tower supporting her head.
meanings.sent5: The meck of the violin added elegance to the musician's performance.

meanings.definition: To repair or fix something quickly and temporarily.
meanings.sent1: He had to meck the leaky faucet before it caused more damage.
meanings.sent2: She quickly mecked the torn page in her notebook with tape.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic had to meck the car's engine to get it running again.
meanings.sent4: He managed to meck the broken chair leg with some glue.
meanings.sent5: She used a mecking technique to temporarily fix the broken toy.
